name: The Langham, London

reviews.title: excellent hotel and location
reviews.text: my daughter bought me my stay as a christmas present and a show and we had a great weekend. what can i say about this hotel. we had a beautiful room and the reception staff were very friendly and helpful. the gym and spa were also very good. thoroughly enjoyed our stay at this hotel and would recommend it highly

Thanks to a good a price (11 pounds) I decide to go in this hotel. It was the first that I went to such a category. I was very surprises by the quality and atmosphere of this palace. When I arrived I receive a superior room instead of a standard. It was full-equiped with a luxurious furniture. (Play station, Internet and Pay-tv). I got everything I need, you don't have to take toothpasta, comb,..), all is provided. The room are large, comfortable with a kingsize bed, desk, table, dressing and a large bathroom.
reviews.title: Great Stay
Wonderful, hope to stay again
reviews.text: The swimming pool is beautiful with a fitness area. There is also cosmetics after having a shower with cream,... In the morning you receive a free newspaper.
The hotel is close to Oxford Circus which is very conveniant when you want to go out or even to walk in the shops.
reviews.title: The best so far

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Probably one of the best hotels in the world!
reviews.title: Pure indulgence

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Only shame that the curse of the travel industry also has reached The Langham; none of the staff we spoke to (many) were Londoners nor British. A place like The Langham looses a lot of it´s identity form that. Not that it can be held against the staff, they were all extremely friendly and professional.
reviews.title: Finally a London Hotel that lives up to its reputation!

reviews.text: We had a memorabble stay, and would come back any day!
reviews.title: Very nice Hotel and Service

reviews.text: Our first visit to The Langham and what a pleasure it was. My wife and I stayed two nights and took the 'Club' package which include a Club Lounge providing excellent refreshments and beverage plus use of computers. It really really annoys me to pay for broadband these days. Located at the top of Regents St it is perfect for shopping (the wife) and the Theatre although just far enough off Oxford St to be quiet. With regards to leisure facilities we did not us them so are unable to comment. Overall we found the staff very attentive, engaging and professional without being cringingly subservient or aloof as you find in some establishments. Catering and Beverage quality first rate. One comment, a trouser press would be nice. We will be back.
reviews.title: Luxury London hotel in great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here in August with 2 young children-the family room was large and clean and the decor was lovely. The room had fresh flowers and 2 big bowls of chocolates, crisps and sweet for the children!!! along with Cupcakes for my Husbands 40th Birthday!! The Hotel is beautifuly decorated and the service was good-although we were made to feel slightly out of place with the children on our 2nd evening when we had a drink in the Palm Court-other than that a thoroughly enjoyable stay.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel stay- few mishaps.....

reviews.text: I have stayed many times in this hotel and this was my first time after the renovation was completed. The hotel was one of the first grand hotels in town and after the refurbishment has a slightly more modern look inside. The rooms are not very large, but very beautifully decorated. If you want quiet rooms -as I do- then request inner-court rooms. The rooms on the front of the hotel are quite a bit larger, but less quiet. The bathrooms are on the smallish side (and do not have a separate shower), but adequate. I have experienced better service at check-in, but this may have been an exception, because usually it is very good and friendly. The location at the top of Regent street is convenient. All in all, not the absolute top in luxury, but certainly enough to go around.
reviews.title: a very pleasant hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We enjoyed our stay at the Langham. It is a grand old building that has been updated with all the modern conveniences, including the bathroom and wire less internet access. The Club Level is especially nice with a separate check in, lounge with food and beverage almost all day, complimentary internet access and complimentary garment pressing. My only issues were the stall shower was cramped and to get to the club level, one has to go up an elevator to the 2nd floor, then walk through a series of hallways. Also, the fitness room was being renovated during our stay and the temporary fitness room was not well equipped.
reviews.title: Top London Hotel

reviews.text: the hotel is indeed quite beautiful and the rooms are nice. The beds and sheets are amazing, as are the spectacular bathrooms. However, many mistakes, both minor and major, were made and when management was made aware of this, no compensation or symbolic gesture was offered to make amends. Better stay at One Aldwych.
reviews.title: Beautiful but faulty service

reviews.text: Great location for shopping and walking to good restaurants. I thought that the concierge service was wonderful and every recommendation that they gave us was great. Rooms are very comfortable and there is a very nice cocktail bar. The doormen were super too and really helpful
reviews.title: great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at The Langham hotel for one night in October and thoroughly enjoyed ourselves. It was our third visit since the hotel refurbishment and this time we enjoyed a Junior Suite on the seventh floor, which had amazing views and was spacious and very comfortable. I really can’t fault any aspect of the rooms or service… the hotel is spotlessly clean and all staff bend over backwards to make your stay the best it can be. Full English breakfast was included in our rate, which was absolutely delicious. I would thoroughly recommend The Langham to anyone wanting to stay in the heart of London, just a stone’s throw from Oxford Circus.
reviews.title: Amazing hotel – faultless rooms and service

reviews.text: very good location, excellent service, very clean, cozy. a little overpriced, i would recommend for business trip
reviews.title: good location, excellent service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed for 2 nights whilst catching up with friends in London. Whilst we did not use any of the facilities or restaurants we were pleasantly surprised with the size and decor of our room (Classic Room) - I think we must have got one of the renovated rooms. Our room overlooked the internal courtyard roof tops - so no view but it meant that it was quiet and we had 2 great nights sleep - this may be disappointing to some guests.
reviews.title: Classic London Hotel

reviews.text: The location was good - I thought it would be a much further walk to Oxford Circus tube but it was only two small blocks away which also meant it was quieter away from the hussle and bussle of Oxford St, Regent St. Quite a few restaurants just down and across the street, Pizza Express, Indian, Cafe style etc.
reviews.title: Superb service - very friendly staff
Very disappointed in Langham Hotel.
reviews.text: Did not have much dealing with staff only to check in and out and this was ok. It was a bit expensive but I guess it is central London and we did book in advance so got a slightly cheaper rate.
It is a classic London hotel with lots of history attached.
reviews.title: Loved the Langham!

reviews.text: I stayed 1 night at the Langham and was shocked by the poor condition of the rooms and how tired this property is. For me it's unbelievable how this property pass the Leading Hotels of the World reviews.
reviews.title: As unsexy as it can get

reviews.text: My room was dull and tired. The bathroom was filthy with a cracked bathtub, dirty shower curtain and cheap bathroom products.
reviews.title: Phenomenal Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The front desk staff was unwilling to help.
reviews.title: Wonderful location if you can afford the price tag!

likes.liked: — I loved the breakfast and the location

reviews.text: The waiters at breakfast was quick and accurate, so were the bellmen.
reviews.title: only nice thing was marble bathroom

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It's outrageous that guests have to pay 15 pounds to use the fitness facilities, unacceptable when you pay close to 300 pounds a night.
reviews.title: All round Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is not going to be a helpful review, because The Langham is deserving of nothing but high marks and praise. My wife and I stayed in a Classic Room during November for our 25th anniversary.
reviews.title: Wonderful

reviews.text: Greetings and bag management by the doormen and porters was flawless. We were walked to Reception and check-in was quick and smooth. As we arrived early, the room was not ready, but reception sent us an email when it became available. All the bags were brought to the room in our absence and the reception staff offered to walk us to the room.
reviews.title: Lovely !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bedroom, bathroom and amenities were exquisite. Furniture and fixtures were first class and we enjoyed just spending time in the room. Particularly enjoyed the bathrobes, slippers, notions set in the bathroom and the no-fog mirrors. Shoe shining was included, which is always great when traipsing around London all day.
reviews.title: Lovely

reviews.text: Concierge staff were helpful a number of times for directions, information and business printing.
reviews.title: Definitely 5*

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For once, going to forgive a hotel for charging for internet – especially at the outrageous price of GBP20 per day. There is a Starbucks across the road with free internet for the price of a coffee that was quite satisfactory. So the Langham gets a strong 5.
reviews.title: Fabulous hotel

reviews.text: We decided to have a Saturday night in town and stayed here after reading the hotel reviews.
reviews.title: Great night away
Highly Recommend
reviews.text: Overall it was a very enjoyable stay. The service was excellent, quick and very friendly.

reviews.title: Pleasantly Surprised
reviews.text: We asked for some additional items for our room and housekeeping delivered them in 5 minutes. We had dinner and the "English" breakfast in the Memories dining room. Dinner was very enjoyable with good informal service but not inexpensive. The wine list prices particularly were on the high side. Breakfast was excellent: I cannot remember such high quality and variety anywhere I have stayed. If the buffet did not contain exactly what you wanted they were prepared to cook specially for you.
The room was quite spacious for London and the bathroom and shower excellent.
reviews.title: Best I have comne across in London

reviews.text: Only downside was the distance sound of music at midnight from a Lloylds TSB sales function in the ballroom. We could hear this and we were on the 5th floor!
reviews.title: Insulting treatment

reviews.text: My mother and I have just returned from a shopping trip to London. A trip that was made perfect by our stay at the Langham.
reviews.title: First Class - Fantastic!

reviews.text: We stayed for 3 nights in a Club room in the Langham Club level of the hotel. The room was fantastic. Good size, modern and all the mod cons you could ask for. The bed was fantastically comfortable, with fine quality linens. The room also had 2 comfortable easy chairs, a cd player and tea and coffee making facilities.
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel

reviews.text: The bathroom was equally as impressive. A fabulous power shower, seperate bath tub, fluffy towels and robes and plenty of quality toiletries.
reviews.title: Disappointment at a price

reviews.text: Our club room gave us access to the club lounge, which serves a beautiful continental breakfast, and drinks and snacks through out the day. My Mum and I where able to return to the lounge several times throughout the day to have canapes and champagne to help us along with our shopping! The lounge serves drinks until 10.30pm and this is included in the price of your room!
reviews.title: Wonderful to return to

reviews.text: We also ate at the hotel restaurant - Memories. Neither of us could fault the meal and service in any way. It was fantastic. In fact we ate at The Ivy the following night and Memories was every bit as good.
reviews.title: 5 star bar!

description: The Langham, London located in the heart of London's West End, a short walk from Oxford circus, has been delighting guests with enchanting hospitality since opening as Europe’s first Grand Hotel in 1865. Following an £80m transformation the hotel will charm you from the moment you step inside her dazzling new lobby. Complimentary to hotel guests, enjoy use of Chuan Spa Fitness Club featuring a state-of-the-art gymnasium and a 16 meter swimming pool.
